info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 6:11AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cabarrus and southeastern Rowan Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 610 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Downtown Concord, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Concord, Mt Pleasant, Rockwell, West Concord, High Rock Lake, Gold Hill and High Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
